body:
Run Java Gradle PreCommit
Run Go PreCommit

Warnings about oauth2client.contrib.multistore_file appeared after upgrading Sphinx.
"tox -e docs" fails on any warnings generated.

Exclude patterns were fixed because the multiprocess runs had this warning:
apache_beam.rst: WARNING: document isn't included in any toctree

I am 95% sure that these Java failures are unrelated.
%5 unsure because I haven't seen these Java failures before.
LGTM. It would be really nice if our primary example didn't require this (messy) setting.

>  It would be really nice if our primary example didn't require this (messy) setting.
+1 to this. At least we bring wordcount_fnapi one step closer to the wordcount. We should be able to remove this file once the last blocker (side inputs) is resolved.
LGTM. I will merge. (For the 5% please pay attention to mailing list, in case this merge causes for failures for others.)
Some presumably-unrelated tests are still failing. Not sure if they're flaky or really failing at this point.
@znewman01 Seems like there is a new github repo for apitools: https://github.com/google/apitools, pypi page (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/google-apitools) is still pointing to the old page.
Please fixup to reduce the number of commits to the repo.
I am still interested in merging this pull request if possible. My company still has a use case for beam with tuples exceeding the default byte size.
hi @XuMingmin , I hava run `mvn clean verify` in `beam/sdks/java/extensions/sql`, all unit test passed. please take a look

Can you try rebasing this on master? The `mvn clean install` job still failed.

You can still merge but I won't be at a machine where I can review code well and merge starting today.

@chamikaramj, @jasonkuster, anyone - PTAL. 
I hope this is last PR related to this Jenkins job

once again LGTM
@akedin : can you please: rebase on master, squash commits into one which message would be something like 

> [BEAM-3181][Nexmark][SQL] Implement query0
Also make sure the tests pass. I'll merge it once it is done
Hi, @lukecwik can you please take a look?

To answer a couple of questions:

- Yes, google/apitools is the new and up-to-date repo for apitools. Will get that page updated.
- There *shouldn't* be any breaking changes; I checked `git log v0.5.11..v0.5.20` and only see:
     - some file upload logic changes (v0.5.19 might cause you to run out of memory uploading a file in a chunk size greater than the amount of free memory you have, but with reasonable chunk sizes should be a non-issue
     - minor auth changes (mostly bugfixes and upgrading oauth library versions
     - don't fail on copying unknown Enum values
     - new features (compression)/sugar (mapping between Python dicts and Message maps)
     - testing/error changes (backwards compat)
     - fix some encoding issues for bytes fields in messages
     - unicode support

  These all seem backwards-compatible.

+CC @kevinli7 FYI

I've made sure that the performance impact is zero when the experiment is not activated (by not adding an observer if that's the case). Let me know what you think!
-P.

@znewman01 Thank you! I appreciate the detailed information.

Could you clarify two points:
1. We pass a custom http client to `BaseApiClient`, using `http` argument. Is there a change related to that?
2. Related to `oauth2client`. We upper-bounded Beam client to `<4.0.0` mainly because of the previous apitools incompatibility. (I believe it was error like `ImportError: cannot import name locked_file`). Could we remove this limitation now?
Python SDK PostCommit must pass. It should include the new HDFS integration test.

Jenkins retest this please. (ERROR: beam8 is offline)
@robertwb , Can you please take a look?

@jkff I’ll try to describe this in short.

Kinesis stream consists of shards which are the base throughput units. Each shard has a capacity of 1MB/s input and 2MB/s output data. So in order to adjust the required throughput you can control the number of shards the stream has. Data records are segregated and routed to shards based on the partition key specified while putting data into the stream. Partition key is hashed and compared with the range of possible hash key values for the shard.

In order to adjust the number of shards in the stream, you have to split or merge already existing shards. Split operation closes the chosen shard and creates two new shards that together cover the same range of hash keys (you can choose the hash key at splitting point). Merging operation closes two specified adjacent shards and creates a new shard that covers the same hash keys range.

Each shard has following properties:
- id
- id of it’s parent (or 2 parents if shard is a result of merging 2 other shards)
- HashKeyRange - the range of possible hash key values for the shard.
- SequenceNumberRange - the range of possible sequence numbers for the shard. Shards that are in the OPEN state have an ending sequence number of null.

So in practice there are 2 situations that need special handling in Kinesis connector. One is at the very beginning, when the connector has to find it’s starting point in Kinesis stream. User can specify starting position by using special descriptors like LATEST, TRIM_HORIZON or by supplying a starting Instant. All these cases are handled by [StartingPointShardsFinder](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/4243/files#diff-f0f164c7ef72631fe4a2c6204c1857c7) class. This class goes over stream shards chronologically and validates them by getting iterator at given starting point and trying to read records. If shard does not pass the validation then it is considered expired and we look for it’s successors. Finally, all valid shards are gathered and used as initial shards.

The second situation that required special handling is the case when reading (in [ShardRecordsIterator](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/4243/files#diff-2575f9e5887ad41e39377fe305272a4b) class) reached the shard’s end. The [GetRecords](http://docs.aws.amazon.com/kinesis/latest/APIReference/API_GetRecords.html#API_GetRecords_ResponseSyntax) operation will return null value for NextShardIterator property then. This means that we need to stop reading this shard and pick up it’s successor(s). This is handled in [ShardReadersPool](https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/4243/files#diff-cb143c1e7f7647878be39b74eaf85a4c) class in a catch clause where KinesisShardClosedException was caught. Firstly we wait until all records read from expired shards are taken from internal queue. Then in readFromSuccessiveShards method we find shard’s successors and replace old shardIterator with the new one(s). In case of merge operation, two shards have one successor so only one of them will be replaced with it.

It’s not a comprehensive description so please let me know if anything is not clear.

@jasonkuster @chamikaramj I noticed that currently FileBasedIOIT disrupts results of `JDBC Dataflow Benchmark` in BigQuery table . This PR uploads pkb results to dedicated table for which I created a Dashboard already. thanks and sorry for trouble
@chamikaramj This PR makes Jenkins job for FileBasedIOIT run on large-scale dataset. Feel free to merge when/if desired.
@chamikaramj small change allowing to pass timeout to PerfKit ran via maven - PTAL

1. I wouldn't expect any changes in that functionality.

2. 0.5.18 is the apitools version that first has full outh2client 4.0+ support (via [63e97c16](https://github.com/google/apitools/commit/63e97c16cb4207f46d4b00f29ec608d4d051366e) and [cbf9c60f](https://github.com/google/apitools/commit/cbf9c60f03ad4457b40447646be281c263f36b78)). So with your change as written (e.g. allowing 0.5.10..0.5.20) I'd say *no*. Once your lower bound is 0.5.18, should be fine.

Thank you @znewman01.

We should consider upgrading our apitools dependency post this change (https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-3391)

Looks good. Please fix the typo in the title: "oauth2cleitn"
Also, still waiting for postcommit to pass.
What's the motivation for UTF-16? Everywhere else we seem to use UTF-8.
Thank you for the quick review, fixed the typo. I will wait for tests before merging.
Python pre-commit and post-commit tests are passing.
LGTM, I can merge after tests pass.
Looks good. Do we already have a containers ready with the updated names? I would recommend running post commit tests before merging.
Do you know why the tests are failing?
Tests seemingly failed for unrelated timeouts. I want to rerun tests again. Asked Jenkins to re-trigger the tests.

hi @XuMingmin，I made some additions: add default `national charset` and `collation`. `uft-16` also as default charset for the N'string' construct

R: @XuMingmin
